[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Type Safety] [Participant Type - Medium] Does the Participant type properly validate participant IDs to prevent out-of-bounds access in share arrays or malformed participant sets?
[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Type Safety] [Scalar Type - Low] Can Scalar values overflow, wrap around, or produce the zero scalar in ways that break signing security?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Serialization] [Signature Encoding - High] When signatures are serialized for Bitcoin transaction inclusion, is the byte ordering and encoding format exactly BIP-340 compliant?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Serialization] [Point Serialization - Medium] Does point serialization for nonce commitments use a canonical encoding that prevents different representations of the same point?
[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Serialization] [Addendum Reading - Low] Does read_addendum() properly validate that the read data is well-formed before passing it to process_addendum()?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [DoS] [Signature Verification - Medium] Can an attacker force validators to perform expensive signature verification operations repeatedly by submitting invalid signatures?
[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [DoS] [Nonce Generation - Low] Is there a limit on how many nonces can be preprocessed per session to prevent memory exhaustion from unbounded preprocessing?
[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [DoS] [Hash Engine - Low] Can the SHA256 hash engine be exploited with pathological inputs to cause excessive CPU usage during challenge computation?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Cross-Network] [Key Reuse - Critical] If the same threshold key is used for both Bitcoin and Ethereum (or other networks), can signature reuse or key extraction attacks work across networks?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Cross-Network] [Challenge Domain - High] Is the BIP-340 challenge computation properly domain-separated from other network signature schemes to prevent cross-network signature validity?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Cross-Network] [Format Confusion - Medium] Can an attacker craft a message that produces valid signatures on multiple networks simultaneously, bypassing network-specific validation?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Economic] [Signature Withholding - Medium] Can malicious validators refuse to provide signature shares for valid transactions to extort fees or cause DoS without being slashed?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Economic] [MEV Extraction - Low] Can validators who control signature share ordering or timing extract MEV by selectively signing or delaying certain Bitcoin transactions?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Advanced Crypto] [Lattice Attacks - Low] If partial nonce information leaks through side-channels, can lattice-based attacks recover the full private key from multiple signatures?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Advanced Crypto] [Fault Injection - Medium] Can fault injection attacks during sign_share() computation cause validators to produce shares that leak key information?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Advanced Crypto] [Quantum Resistance - Low] While secp256k1 is not quantum-resistant, does the threshold signing introduce additional quantum vulnerabilities beyond standard ECDSA?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Edge Cases] [Zero Signature - Medium] Can the signing process ever produce a zero s value in the signature, and if so, is this handled correctly by Bitcoin nodes?
[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Edge Cases] [Maximum Scalar - Low] What happens if the challenge computation produces a scalar equal to the curve order, and is this handled without panics?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Edge Cases] [Identity Point - Medium] Can the signing process ever use the identity point (point at infinity) as the nonce, and would this be detected before signature generation?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Line 14] [DoS - High] The to_encoded_point(true) call for compressed encoding - can malformed ProjectivePoint internal state cause this to return None even for non-infinity points?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Line 15] [DoS - Critical] The expect on x() extraction assumes the point is not at infinity, but is there any validation earlier in the call chain to guarantee this invariant?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Line 22] [DoS - High] XOnlyPublicKey::from_slice() can fail if the 32 bytes don't represent a valid x-coordinate - are there curve membership checks before this point?
[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Line 27] [Timing - High] The u8::from() conversions in ct_eq - do these preserve constant-time properties, or can the type conversion leak information?

[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Line 60] [Correctness - Critical] The const_hash of 'BIP0340/challenge' must exactly match BIP-340 - has this been validated against the reference implementation?
[File: networks/bitcoin/src/crypto.rs] [Line 63-67] [Ordering - High] The SHA256 input order (TAG, TAG, x(R), x(A), m) must exactly match BIP-340 - is this order verified against test vectors?
